Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk anaconda
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: anaconda bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description: The anaconda packages contain portions of the Anaconda installation program that can be run by the user for reconfiguration and advanced installation options. Bug fixes: Interface names based on the position of the device in the hardware were bound to the media access control (MAC) address via the HWADDR directive. As a consequence, the MAC binding rendered the position-based naming useless, and swapping a PCI network card required the card to be reconfigured. With this update, dracut no longer assigns MAC address binding to interfaces with HWADDR. As a result, persistent interface names do not depend on the MAC address, and swapping a PCI network card does not require rewriting the configuration. (BZ#1130042) A flag for rescue mode was not set properly, which prevented the user from using rescue mode from the boot menu. This bug has been fixed. (BZ#1143056) Anaconda assumed that user's home directories could be located only in the /home// directory. Consequently, an attempt to create a new user account with a home directory located elsewhere failed. Now, Anaconda allows users to create their home directories also in other locations. (BZ#1163775) Setting a custom group membership in the Anaconda GUI did not work correctly and newly-created users could not be added to the custom groups. This bug has been fixed. (BZ#1163803) Enhancements: When booting a root partition with multiple mount points from an iSCSI disk, the mount points are mounted at the same time as the root partition to boot successfully. (BZ#740106) Anaconda now logs the START, FINISH, and ABORTED states to the Intelligent Platform Management Interface (IPMI) to allow other monitoring utilities to track the state of the installation. (BZ#782019) When booting from an iSCSI disk, the VLAN IDs from the iSCSI Boot Firmware Table (iBFT) are now used. (BZ#804511) The kickstart "lvm --profile" option has been added to support thin logical volumes. (BZ#869456) Platform-specific packages are now installed automatically based on the used virtualization platform. (BZ#884385) Users can now select the language that will be used on the installed system from text mode. (BZ#1000326) The kickstart "%addon" command now supports additional arguments. (BZ#1065674) The "Help!" button has been added to the upper right corner of every installer screen. Pressing this button opens a window with the help content specific to the current screen. (BZ#1072033) Anaconda now gathers random data entropy if the disk is encrypted in order to prevent possible security issues, which could be caused by creating an encrypted format with a low degree of random data entropy. Therefore, Anaconda waits until enough entropy is gathered when creating an encrypted format and suggests the user how to reduce the waiting time. (BZ#1073679) Anaconda now supports the creation of network bridges using the GUI or the kickstart "network" command. (BZ#1075195) The kickstart "liveimg" command now supports tar file packages by matching the suffix of the file to one of the following: .tar, .tbz, .tgz, .txz, .tar.bz2, tar.gz, or tar.xz. (BZ#1080396) The kickstart "autopart" command now supports the "--fstype=" option allowing the user to select any of the supported file systems as the one to use when automatically partitioning the system. (BZ#1112697) Support for the OSTree utility has been added. (BZ#1113535) Anaconda now supports the Wi-Fi Protected Access (WPA) wireless connections during the installation. (BZ#1120374) Certain utilities, for example Docker, do not need a full installation. To support a partial installation of such utilities, several kickstart options have been added. (BZ#1123479) Users of anaconda are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
